utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: This is outrageous, sir! You are nothing but a well dressed loan shark.

utterance.speaker: MR DAVENPORT
utterance.content: Ms. Rodgers, I assure you, this is a very competitive interest rate considering your financial history. However if your son cosigns –

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: No, no, no, no. This is my loan, not his, to pay for repairs to my acting studio, not his.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If you just let me cosign the loan … or I could give you the money.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Richard. I’m a businesswoman now. I do not want your money, I do not want your signature. Thank you very much.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: It’s the principle.

utterance.speaker: DAVENPORT
utterance.content: No Ms. Rodgers, it’s the interest.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And I’ve just lost mine. Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you want, Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tell me you need me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m stuck at a bank, helping my mother get a loan from my banker. Please tell me there’s a murder somewhere we can be solving.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ah, sorry. There’s no dead bodies, just a lot of paperwork. But you’re welcome to come and do your share, for once.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The only thing worse than being here is being there doing paperwork.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, how come we’re partners when I’m chasing down bad guys and as soon as there’s paperwork I’m on a solo mission?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Huh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think this bank is about to be robbed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? Are you that bored?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s a man and a woman, dressed in scrubs, and both of them have suspicious bulges in their jackets.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I think your writer’s imagination is getting away with you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s not my imagination. It’s definitely not my imagination.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, what’s happening?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where are you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m at the New Amsterdam Bank and Trust on Lex.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Esposito, there’s a 1030, New Amsterdam Bank and Trust on Lex. Call dispatch.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: 1030? Since when are we handling bank robbery calls?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle’s there.

utterance.speaker: DR HOWSER
utterance.content: Throw down your cell phones now!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m behind a desk with my mother. I can see everything. They’re wearing doctor’s scrubs. One of them is emptying the cash drawers.

utterance.speaker: DR HUXTABLE
utterance.content: Bank manager, over here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Another one is going for the bank manager.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s taking the manager’s key. He’s going to the back of the bank.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, we’ve got squad cars en route.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I need you to listen very carefully. How many are there?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There are three.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Make that four.

utterance.speaker: TRAPPER JOHN
utterance.content: So you’re the hero I’m going to make an example of.

utterance.speaker: TRAPPER JOHN
utterance.content: Sorry, friend can’t talk right now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I wouldn’t worry about him. I’d worry about yourself.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ve got squad cars on their way.

utterance.speaker: TRAPPER JOHN
utterance.content: You’re a cop? You called a cop?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I – we were already on the line when you guys came in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Listen to me. So far nobody has been hurt and nothing has been stolen. So if you just leave the same way that you came in, you can just disappear.

utterance.speaker: TRAPPER JOHN
utterance.content: You gonna promise not to come look for me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t look, I hunt. And trust me, you don’t want that. So leave now and this’ll just be a quirky little article in the metro section.

utterance.speaker: TRAPPER JOHN
utterance.content: Sorry, sweetheart. I’d rather make the front page.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: TRAPPER JOHN
utterance.content: Dr. Howser, Dr. Quinn. Cops are going to be here sooner than we thought.

utterance.speaker: DR HOWSER
utterance.content: All right, kiss the floor like the others. C’mon, you two. Get down!

utterance.speaker: DR QUINN
utterance.content: Dr. Huxtable, let’s go!

utterance.speaker: DR HUXTABLE
utterance.content: All right. Bank cameras, they’re down, memory drive destroyed.

utterance.speaker: TRAPPER JOHN
utterance.content: Cops! All right, doctors. We’ve trained for this. You know what to do. Looks like we’re all going to get to know each other a lot better.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN PETERSON
utterance.content: I need SWAT analysis, sit rep, building blueprints. Five minutes.

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: Who are you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Detective Kate Beckett, homicide.

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: I’ll be sure to call if someone dies. Meanwhile, I need you to step outside –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, sir. My partner is in that bank.

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: Wait, we got a cop in there?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s a civilian investigator. He and I were on the phone when they took over the bank. He said that there are four suspects in there, they’re dressed up in doctor’s scrubs.

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: Anything else you can tell me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I spoke with one of the suspects.

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: And what was the demeanor?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Calm, actually. Very calm.

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: Thanks for the intel. We’ll do everything we can to get your partner out safe.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so what’s our next move?

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: Well, your next move is to leave my command post.

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: You want to help your partner? Let me do my job.

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: I need a line on that bank. I want to talk to his guy.

utterance.speaker: OFFICER MONFRIEZ
utterance.content: Yes, sir.

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: You missed your cue, Detective.

utterance.speaker: DR HUXTABLE
utterance.content: All right. I’m going to make this real simple. You move, you die.

utterance.speaker: DR HUXTABLE
utterance.content: Got it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is anyone hurt?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right. Stay relaxed. Do as they say. We’ll get through this. The cops will get us out.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What did you find out?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That our services aren’t needed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Espo, do you still have buddies in ESU?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Good. I want to know what they know. And let’s get a hold of major crimes, find out if there are any other robberies with similar MO’s. The more we know about these guys the more leverage we got.

utterance.speaker: OFFICER MONFRIEZ
utterance.content: Detective Beckett! Captain Peterson would like a word.

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: Tell me. What were you thinking?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I was just trying to help out, sir.

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: What, by charming the bank robber?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: We get him on the horn, but before I can get two words out he says, and I quote, “I will only talk to the lady cop. The one with the bedroom voice." Yeah. You wanted in? Well, you’re in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No sir, I don’t have any training in hostage negotiations.

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: Well, I don’t have time to give you a seminar, so think of it like this. You do the opposite of whatever your homicide training tells you, okay? So don’t yell, don’t bully, don’t – don’t threaten him in any way. It’s all about keeping him calm.

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: Detective, you up for this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah, absolutely.

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: Now it’s important to keep him talking. You’ve gotta build rapport. As long as he’s busy talking, he’s not busy hurting hostages.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: Okay?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: TRAPPER JOHN
utterance.content: Who’s this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This is Detective Kate Beckett. I understand you wanted to speak with me.

utterance.speaker: TRAPPER JOHN
utterance.content: Yeah, I don’t like that other guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, me either.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You said to build a rapport.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what’s your name?

utterance.speaker: TRAPPER JOHN
utterance.content: You can call me Trapper John.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A M*A*S*H fan. It’s nice. So, how’re you doing? Anything I can do to help?

utterance.speaker: TRAPPER JOHN
utterance.content: Oh Kate, Kate, Kate. You’re running that idiot’s playbook, aren’t you?

utterance.speaker: TRAPPER JOHN
utterance.content: What did Captain Confidence tell you? Keep me calm? Build rapport? Extract information? Here’s how it’s going to work. You lie to me, I kill hostages. You jerk me around, I kill hostages. You storm the bank, I kill hostages. And Kate? I’ll start with your boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: Well, we learned one thing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s that?

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: He’s not a punk who woke up and decided to rob a bank. He knows what he’s doing. He knows our playbook. This guy’s a pro. SWAT tap into the cameras at the bank yet?

utterance.speaker: OFFICER MONFRIEZ
utterance.content: Still working on it, sir. Also, there’s a Susan Craig for the bank’s main branch on the line for you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, what do you want me to do?

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry?

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: It’s not a homicide, Detective. It’s not about moving forward or digging for the next clue. Here, sometimes no move is the best move. Let Trapper John think about things and we’ll call him back.

utterance.speaker: SAL
utterance.content: This is your fault, you know. He called the cops. I saw him. If it wasn’t for this guy, the bank robbers would have come and gone and we’d all be out of here.

utterance.speaker: SIMONE
utterance.content: No. No, the cops were coming anyway. The bank robbers, they screwed up. They pulled the bottom bills form the cash drawer.

utterance.speaker: DAVENPORT
utterance.content: Which automatically triggers the silent alarm, okay? No one’s fault.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Simone, how far along are you?

utterance.speaker: SIMONE
utterance.content: 32 weeks.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ahh.

utterance.speaker: GRACE
utterance.content: Holding a pregnant woman hostage? They should let you go.

utterance.speaker: ABE
utterance.content: Lady, they’re not letting her go. They’re not letting any of us go. I’ve seen this movie before. I know how it ends - with all of us dead.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. We’re not going to die. We’re going to be fine. I work with the police and my partner is going to get us out.

utterance.speaker: TRAPPER JOHN
utterance.content: Dr. Huxtable.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mr. Davenport, what’s behind those doors back there?

utterance.speaker: DAVENPORT
utterance.content: Rest room, break room, security room, and the safe deposit boxes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I saw them take a key from around your neck. What does it open?

utterance.speaker: DAVENPORT
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s my security key for the safe deposit boxes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Something is going on here. Why does he keep going back there when there’s a vault full of cash up here that’s untouched?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah, Richard. I know that look. Please, curiosity killed the cat.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Something weird is going on here. We need to figure out what it is. And I know exactly what to do. Don’t worry, Mother. I saw this work on Die Hard.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, great.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, Mr. Howser, excuse me, Dr. Howser.

utterance.speaker: DR HOWSER
utterance.content: You got a death wish?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, no. Just a small bladder, and uh, unfortunately it looks like we’re going to be here for awhile, so unless you’d like it messy, now would be a good time to start arranging some restroom runs.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, why Doogie Howser? There’s so many cooler doctors you could pick. Dr. House, Dr. Shepherd, Dr. Phil –

utterance.speaker: DR HOWSER
utterance.content: Shut up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anything?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All bad news. ESU can’t get eyes or ears inside. Bank cameras are disabled and the walls are too thick to drill from outside.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what if ESU storms the bank?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: They’ll be going in blind.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And in your experience, in this scenario, what are the hostages' chances of survival?

utterance.speaker: DAVENPORT
utterance.content: Hey, um, I’m sorry about before.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, please, it’s –

utterance.speaker: DAVENPORT
utterance.content: It’s the job.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: DAVENPORT
utterance.content: Actually, I’m a fan.

utterance.speaker: DAVENPORT
utterance.content: A Midsummer Night’s Dream? You played Titania in Shakespeare in the Park.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: That was in the 80s. How could you possibly remember that?

utterance.speaker: DAVENPORT
utterance.content: Oh, you were unforgettable.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: If I have to die, I’m glad I’m going with someone who knows my work. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: DR HOWSER
utterance.content: All right, who else needs the loo?

utterance.speaker: SAL
utterance.content: I’ll go.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Did you learn anything?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Two things. Firstly, the restrooms here at the bank are quite lovely, excepting for the lack of windows or any other means of escape.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Second, and more importantly, I was right. Something odd is going on. I saw Trapper John in the safe deposit box room. He pulled out a box and he was removing … letters and photos. He didn’t break in, either. He used both keys.

utterance.speaker: DAVENPORT
utterance.content: Well, one’s my manager’s key, the other one must be the owner’s key.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: This is a very strange time for Trapper John to get something from his safety deposit box.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I’m assuming the box isn’t his. These guys set off the alarm on purpose. They wanted the hostage standoff. I mean, c’mon. Look at these guys. They’re professionals, right? They know better than to take the bottom bills from the cash drawer.

utterance.speaker: DAVENPORT
utterance.content: But why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Time. Safe deposit box keys don’t have numbers on them, so if it’s not his key he’d have to try every lock until he got to the right box, and that would take time. Okay, Mr. Davenport, the – the box he pulled was on the north wall, it was … four columns over, three boxes down.

utterance.speaker: DAVENPORT
utterance.content: That would be … box … 120.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. We figure out whose box that is, we can figure out what these people are really up to.

utterance.speaker: DAVENPORT
utterance.content: Yeah well, I don’t think they’ll let us use the computer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe we won’t have to. Mother, the bracelet I gave you for your birthday.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh no, I love this bracelet.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah… all right.

utterance.speaker: OFFICER MONFRIEZ
utterance.content: Captain, it’s him.

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: Remember the strategy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. How’s it going?

utterance.speaker: TRAPPER JOHN
utterance.content: So far so good.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah? And how are the hostages? I’m pretty concerned about the pregnant bank teller Simone. It’s kind of a stressful situation, might want to get her out of there.

utterance.speaker: TRAPPER JOHN
utterance.content: No, no, no, Kate. You’ve got to give before you can receive.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, what would you like?

utterance.speaker: TRAPPER JOHN
utterance.content: A bus. With tinted windows, that’ll take me, my partners, and my hostages to Teterboro Airport. There you’re going to have a plane waiting to take us to the foreign country of my choosing. Now you do that, I give you the knocked up bank teller. Once we land in paradise, I release the rest of the hostages. And Kate? You got three hours.

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: Okay, Monfriez, find me a bus with tinted windows and get it over here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute, you’re actually giving him what he wants?

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: Of course not. The only way that guy is leaving the building is in handcuffs or a body bag. But if it comes to it, I can use that bus to lure the robbers out, have snipers take them out.

utterance.speaker: MONFRIEZ
utterance.content: What the…? You see that?

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s Morse code.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Stop, Richard.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Clear.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: S-D-B 1-2-0 over and over again. What do you think it means?

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: Uh, somebody’s initials? A code? Same … day… bank…

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Save …

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: Same…

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, save… uh, could be, um… save… safe deposit box. Safe deposit box 120. That’s it.

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: What does a safe deposit box have to do with anything?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know, but if Castle went to the trouble of sending that message, it means something.

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: Well, how do you know it’s him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Trust me, it’s him.

utterance.speaker: MONFRIEZ
utterance.content: Safe deposit box 120 belongs to a married couple, Agnes and Gideon Fields.

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: Anything special about that box?

utterance.speaker: MONFRIEZ
utterance.content: No, just that records show that they both access it monthly.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll get my team to check it out.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Richard … be innocent. Be innocent.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: You’re indicating.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: See, even a layman can spot an uninspired performance, hon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, Mother.

utterance.speaker: SAL
utterance.content: Hey, when I was coming back, I got a glimpse inside their duffel bag. There were white bricks with wires and timers attached to it. I – I think it could be C4.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: C4? Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: SAL
utterance.content: Yeah. They’re going to blow us up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Just calm down.

utterance.speaker: SAL
utterance.content: How am I supposed to calm down? I’ve got a family to think about.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: We all have families. Now calm down.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s your name?

utterance.speaker: SAL
utterance.content: Sal. Sal Martino.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. You got a wife, Sal? Kids?

utterance.speaker: SAL
utterance.content: Yeah. I have a son.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s his name?

utterance.speaker: SAL
utterance.content: Connor.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I bet the only thing you can think about it seeing him again, am I right?

utterance.speaker: SAL
utterance.content: You have no idea.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Good. So you just keep thinking on that. You think about how you’re going to see Connor again real soon. Because I’m going to figure out a way to get us all out of here. I promise.

utterance.speaker: SAL
utterance.content: I need some air. Damn, why is there no air in this place?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What the hell is going on here? I thought this was about a safe deposit box. Why would they need C4?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Maybe they don’t want anyone to know what they stole from that box and the C4 is to make sure that no one ever does.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Agnes and Gideon Fields, open up please! This is the NYPD.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This doesn’t make any sense. What could this old couple’s safe deposit box have to do with what’s going on in that bank?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe everything. Bank said that Agnes and Gideon were accessing their box once a month, right?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I just got a text from the precinct. Gideon Fields died four years ago, so whoever is accessing that box wasn’t him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Agnes! This is NYPD! Open up, please.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The radio’s on.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa … we can’t go in there. We don’t have a warrant. We don’t have probable cause.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Bro, Castle’s life depends on this.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did you just hear that? I think I just heard someone yell out ‘help, police!’.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: ‘Help, police!’ There it is again.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: NYPD!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Agnes!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s Agnes.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What the hell is going on here?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Looks like the owner of our safety deposit box has been dead maybe a week. Ligature marks on her neck indicate strangulation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’d you find at the crime scene?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Place is trashed. Killer was looking for something. There’s a broken keychain necklace on the body, but there’s no key.

utterance.content: Hey! I said stop!

utterance.content: That’s not enough time.

utterance.content: It is for me. Take this guy now, and get my bus outside in 20, or I’ll start popping hostages.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How soon ‘til we get that bus?

utterance.speaker: OFFICE MONFRIEZ
utterance.content: 35 minutes.

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: We’re going to have to ask for more time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s not gonna go for it.

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: Then we’re going to storm the bank.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We can’t storm the bank. We don’t know where anybody is in there. If we go in there, hostages are just gonna get killed.

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: Listen, if we’re going to save any of them, we have no other choice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe we do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We can use this sick hostage to our advantage. Instead of sending in a paramedic, we send in a cop with tactical training. That cop gets intel for when SWAT goes in to breach the bank.

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: I’m guessing you have a cop in mind?

utterance.speaker: TRAPPER JOHN
utterance.content: Search her.

utterance.speaker: DR QUINN
utterance.content: She’s clear.

utterance.speaker: TRAPPER JOHN
utterance.content: Make it quick.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How’s he doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not good.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: His name is Sal Martino. He has epilepsy. I think the seizure was brought on by stress.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, Sal. Hey, buddy. How’re you doing? Sal, listen to me. I want you to know there are people out there that care about you, so just keep breathing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I promise you, I’m going to get you out of here.

utterance.speaker: DR HUXTABLE
utterance.content: Hey. Don’t talk about it. Be about it. And you, help get him on that gurney. Now!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay Sal, you ready? We’re going to get you up on the count of three. Ready? One, two .. three.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Easy buddy. You’re all right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Your Dad’s okay. They’re both -

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: - okay. Oh God.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Alexis, I need you to go behind the yellow line, now. Take her behind the line, now!

utterance.speaker: ASHLEY
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Ash, my father - !

utterance.speaker: ASHLEY
utterance.content: Wait, what?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Can you hear me?

utterance.speaker: ASHLEY
utterance.content: I’ll call you later.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No, you can’t call me later!

utterance.speaker: ASHLEY
utterance.content: I can’t hear –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I can’t hear you. What? Ash, I can’t –

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: There’s C4 in the bank?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I didn’t see any, but if Castle says it’s in there, it’s in there.

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: Well, that means a breach is out of the question. I’m not going to send my boys into a bomb fight. We’re going to have to take these guys out on the bus.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That bus is still 20 minutes out. His deadline’s in 5. He’s going to start killing hostages.

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: Then we have to buy more time.

utterance.speaker: TRAPPER JOHN
utterance.content: Where’s my bus?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The bus is on its way. It’ll be there in 20 minutes.

utterance.speaker: TRAPPER JOHN
utterance.content: A hostage will be dead in 2.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, nobody needs to die, okay? It’s coming, it’s just – it’s stuck in traffic.

utterance.speaker: TRAPPER JOHN
utterance.content: We have rules, Kate. I said I wouldn’t kill anyone, you said you’d get me a bus. I lived up to my end of the deal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And I’m going to live up to mine, it just –

utterance.speaker: TRAPPER JOHN
utterance.content: I warned you not to jerk me around. Now I was clear about the consequences. Do I have to prove how serious I am? Is that it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, I – I think we both just need to take a deep breath and we can talk about this…

utterance.speaker: TRAPPER JOHN
utterance.content: I’m done talking!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was that?

utterance.speaker: TRAPPER JOHN
utterance.content: A warning shot, Kate. The next one’s for the kill!

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Don’t you touch him, you son of a b*itch!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey! Hey, hold her back! I got this!

utterance.speaker: TRAPPER JOHN
utterance.content: I’m going to make pretty red stains out of your boyfriend, Kate. I got my gun to his throat and I’m going to paint a Jackson Pollock with his insides.

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: You need to calm him down.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Listen to me, jackass. I do not control traffic, so you’re going to have to give me 20 minutes.

utterance.speaker: TRAPPER JOHN
utterance.content: Now you got 1 minute, Kate!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No! I’ve got 20. Do you hear me? 20. Because if you pull that trigger, I will walk through those doors and personally put a bullet through your skull.

utterance.speaker: TRAPPER JOHN
utterance.content: Okay, Kate. You’ve got 20 more minutes.

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: Well, that’s one way to negotiate.

utterance.speaker: TRAPPER JOHN
utterance.content: Your girlfriend is a hellcat.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah well, she’s not my girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: TRAPPER JOHN
utterance.content: She too much woman for you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So why’re you guys robbing this bank?

utterance.speaker: TRAPPER JOHN

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Except Willie Sutton never said that. It was a reporter that made up that quote. See, writers … we’re really good at altering reality to fit the narrative. And the story I see you guys spinning here, it’s really not about stealing money.

utterance.speaker: TRAPPER JOHN
utterance.content: Is that so?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You and your crew don’ wear gloves. Obviously you’re not worried about fingerprints, so you’re not in the system. And those accents? They’re mercs. Which means you’re too smart to get on that bus. So… what was in that box? Why the C4 and what are you really going to do with us?

utterance.speaker: TRAPPER JOHN
utterance.content: Oh, I like you. That’s why I’m going to kill you last.

utterance.speaker: DR HUXTABLE

utterance.speaker: TRAPPER JOHN
utterance.content: All right. Everyone on your feet. Let’s go … up, up, up, up!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What are you going to do?

utterance.speaker: TRAPPER JOHN
utterance.content: You’re clever. I’m sure you’ll figure it out.

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: We’ve still got 18 minutes. I want everyone in position. SWAT can rendezvous with the bus here on 49th. They can load there. I want snipers here, here, and here. Get Roman on the horn.

utterance.content: What?

utterance.content: Sir, he gave me 20 minutes and he didn’t ask for anything in return. If he wanted to maintain control he would have asked for something. I mean, this is all way too easy.

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: Take the win, Detective.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, sir. Something is going on, we’re just not asking the right questions. I mean, why would he bring C4 to a bank robbery? What does Agnes Fields' murder have to do with any of this?

utterance.content: Captain, I’ve got Sergeant Roman.

utterance.content: Yeah, Roman.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mother, I find I’m no longer satisfied with the customer service at this establishment. I think we should take our business elsewhere.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I’m so sorry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Forgive me for dragging you into this …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s okay. It’s okay. I love you, Mother.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Right back at you, kiddo.

utterance.content: Did you find anything on Agnes?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about, um… Agnes’s safety deposit box? Somebody was pretending to be her dead husband and accessed monthly. Any leads?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nothing so far.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Relatives?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Uh, Agnes didn’t really have any relatives left. Her husband’s dead, her daughter and grandson died in a boating accident over a year ago.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The only surviving relative is a former son-in-law, Ron Brandt. We left a message, we haven’t heard back yet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, we don’t have time to wait for a return phone call, so find –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle! Castle!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett!

utterance.content: They’re here!

utterance.content: I told you! Huh!

utterance.content: Here we go. Ready? Okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How are you?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: He’s not the only one here, you know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m so –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m so sorry, Martha.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How’re you doing?

utterance.speaker: PETERSON
utterance.content: Everybody accounted for?

utterance.speaker: DAVENPORT
utterance.content: We’re all here, we’re all okay.

utterance.content: What?

utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.content: It’s not possible. C4, it’s a very stable explosive. It wouldn’t go off accidentally and these guys were not dime store bandits. They were trained. They were military precision, they were … they wouldn’t set off an explosion prematurely.

utterance.content: Former son-in-law Ron Brandt. Left a message, but he does a lot of business overseas. He might not even be in the country.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, so he uses his military connections to hire that team of mercenaries in the bank, and then to avoid loose ends, Ron rigs the C4 to blow early.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Former mother-in-law?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Ron was married to Agnes’s daughter, Tanya. Both her and her son Connor were killed in a boating accident about a year ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, no. Ron spoke about Connor, and he did not speak about him like he was dead. Connor is still alive.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t know what to tell you, Castle. It says right here Connor’s dead.

utterance.content: I’m not so sure about that. Turns out neither his wife Tanya nor Connor’s body was recovered.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why would the wife fake their deaths?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Domestic abuse. However, Ron had the connections and the wealth to avoid prosecution.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So the system failed her.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She and Connor couldn’t escape Ron’s abuse, so she faked their deaths and disappeared.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but to disappear she had to walk away from her former life.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sever ties with everyone and everything she ever knew.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Except she couldn’t, especially with her mom Agnes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which is what the safety deposit box was for. It’s a means of communication. It’s like a Cold War drop box in some John LeCarre novel, only… Tanya wouldn’t be able to risk making the drops. So who would make the drops for her?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Our mystery man, who was posing as Agnes’s dead husband. He was Tanya’s middle man.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so Tanya sends the photos and the letters to the middle man, the middle man puts them in the safety deposit box for Agnes… the box serves as a mailbox.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Only better than a mailbox, because it’s locked up inside a bank.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ron must have suspected that they faked their deaths and that’s when he bugged Agnes’ home.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And when Ron found out about the box, he killed Agnes for the key.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. And with the clock ticking, he hired that crew to stage the bank robbery to get to the box with that key.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, those photos and letters will say exactly where his wife and son are hiding. He’s on his way there now. And we know what he’s going to do once he gets there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s going to kidnap his son and kill his wife.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Finding the middle man is the only way we’re going to be able to find Tanya and Connor. So what do we know? He passed for Agnes’ late husband.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And it would have to be someone that Ron wouldn’t suspect.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That rules out friends, neighbors, and coworkers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But it was probably a person that they trusted.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The middleman could have been paid. Maybe we can track their payments.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, they were probably smart enough to pay in cash, which is untraceable.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah - unless - if paying by check wouldn’t have thrown up any red flags, and at the time of Tanya and Connor’s supposed deaths, she was making monthly tithe checks to St. Abigail’s Church.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And who better fits this profile than a priest?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I know which one we should speak to first.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The priest that officiated their funeral. Father Sean McCaskey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Father McCaskey, I’m Detective Kate Beckett. This is Richard Castle. We need to know where Tanya and Connor Brandt are hiding.

utterance.speaker: FATHER SEAN MCCASKEY
utterance.content: I don’t know what you’re talking about. Tanya and Connor have been dead for over a year.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Father, you don’t understand. Agnes Fields has been murdered. Ron Brandt has the contents of her safe deposit box. He’s on his way to them now.

utterance.speaker: FATHER MCCASKEY
utterance.content: What? How could this happen? That box was there to protect them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It didn’t, Father, but we can. We need to know their address.

utterance.speaker: FATHER MCCASKEY
utterance.content: Of course. 14 Caskadilla Street. Ithaca.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ithaca? That’s only 4 hours away. Ron could already be there by now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: FATHER MCCASKEY
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: RON
utterance.content: Honey. I’m home.

utterance.speaker: TANYA
utterance.content: Stay back. I will kill you.

utterance.speaker: RON
utterance.content: Now, Tanya. Is this any way to greet your husband?

utterance.speaker: RON
utterance.content: Oh no, hon, you bumped your head.

utterance.speaker: RON
utterance.content: Hey, hey. That’s my boy. Did you miss your daddy?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C’mon… come on.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What the hell’s taking so long?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I can’t believe they’ve still got us on hold.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett, if he gets a hold of that kid…

utterance.speaker: TANYA
utterance.content: Please don’t take him! Please!

utterance.speaker: TANYA
utterance.content: Not in front of him. Please. My baby!

utterance.speaker: RON
utterance.content: Why would I kill you? I want you to live a long, long life with the knowledge that you’re never going to see Connor again.

utterance.speaker: TANYA
utterance.content: My baby …

utterance.speaker: RON
utterance.content: Now it’s my turn to disappear. But unlike you, I know how to hide.

utterance.speaker: TANYA
utterance.content: Connor! Connor!

utterance.speaker: RON
utterance.content: I got you. I got you.

utterance.speaker: POLICEMAN
utterance.content: Think real hard about your next move.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What? Okay. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They found them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Tanya’s going to need a few stitches, but Connor’s okay.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: C’mon, let’s go pick ‘em up.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ithaca?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Even as a hostage I help you solve murders. Beckett, I think – I think you have the perfect partner.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, except he doesn’t like doing paperwork.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Touché.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, Old Haunt? I’ll buy you a drink.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. But I’ll do you one better.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, Kate! Oh, darling! You can join us. Oh, you great, beautiful creature, come in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, Martha … you – you really outdid yourself.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I did. Facing death demands celebrating life. Tonight we feast.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where’s Alexis?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, she’s uh …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Excuse me one minute.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: So … …yes?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Please.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Ash, it’s not about today, it’s about the last 100 days. You’re never here for me. Just because you’re in California doesn’t mean I should have to hold my breath, cross my fingers, and wish upon a star just to get a text from you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah, more excuses. Ash, I just can’t do this anymore. We’re done.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No. But ask me again tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Alexis darling, help me with the duck l’orange, s'il vous plait.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, thank you. And I didn’t get a chance to properly thank you for saving my life.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, there’s no need, Castle. We’re partners. It’s what we do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. Some of us more than others, of course.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait … what is that supposed to mean?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Only that this is the 8th time you’ve saved my life and I’ve saved your life 9 times.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, first of all, I can’t even believe that you’re keeping score. And secondly, there is no way that you’ve saved my life more than I have yours. 9? Please.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, let’s review, shall we?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The first time I distracted the mad gunman with the champagne bottle. And yes, that was a save, even you admitted it. The second time. The um… serial killer who put a bomb in your kitchen while you were taking a shower. I had to brave the hellish flames to pull you out of your bathtub. Won’t be forgetting that any time soon.
